meanings.definition: A plant of the genus Mitella, typically with small white flowers.
meanings.sent1: In the garden, the mitreworts added a delicate touch with their tiny blooms.
meanings.sent2: The forest floor was dotted with various mitreworts, each displaying its unique beauty.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous squirrel used the mitreworts as tiny umbrellas during the rain.
meanings.sent4: The mitreworts stood like a miniature army of white soldiers guarding the forest.
meanings.sent5: As I walked through the woods, the mitreworts seemed to whisper secrets to each other.

meanings.definition: The plural form of mitrewort, referring to multiple plants of the genus Mitella.
meanings.sent1: We admired the cluster of mitreworts growing near the stream.
meanings.sent2: The hikers marveled at the abundance of mitreworts covering the forest floor.
meanings.sent3: The garden looked like a mitreworts convention with so many plants gathered.
meanings.sent4: The field of mitreworts resembled a sea of tiny white stars under the moonlight.
meanings.sent5: The meadow was alive with the gentle sway of the mitreworts in the breeze.
